text: 12 E. A. PIMENTEL AND J.M. URBANO From the regularity theory available for we infer the existence of a pair such that as By the stability of weak solutions, Proposition ??, we conclude that satisfies  and hence, is harmonic. Therefore, by setting we reach a contradiction and the proof is complete. In the next proposition, we produce an oscillation control for the difference of and a paraboloid  Proposition 5.2. Suppose A??-A?? are in force and let  be a solution to (??). Then, there exists a universal constant such that  for some and. Proof. Indeed, given a solution to (??), define for some to be fixed. Notice the pair solves (5.1)

as By the stability of weak solutions, Proposition ??, we conclude

that satisfies

<math id="S5.Ex11.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\sup_{B_{\rho}}\,\left|\theta(x)\,-\,\left(a\,+\,b\cdot x\,+\,\frac{1}{2}x^{T}%Mx\right)\right|\,\leq\,\rho^{2}," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><munder><mo movablelimits="false">sup</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mi>œÅ</mi></msub></munder></mpadded><mo>‚Å°</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>Œ∏</mi><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo rspace="4.2pt" stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">-</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>a</mi></mpadded><mo rspace="4.2pt">+</mo><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo>‚ãÖ</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>x</mi></mpadded></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">+</mo><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>‚Å¢</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mi>T</mi></msup><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mi>M</mi><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">|</mo></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">‚â§</mo><msup><mi>œÅ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

<math id="S5.E1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\begin{cases}-\operatorname{div}\left(\left|Du\right|^{\sigma_{K}(\theta_{K}(x%))-2}Du\right)\,=\,f\\\\-\Delta\theta_{K}\,=\,\lambda_{K}\left(\theta_{K}(x)\right)\left|Du\right|^{%\sigma_{K}(\theta_{K}(x))},\end{cases}" display="block"><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mo>div</mo><mo>‚Å°</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mi>u</mi></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>œÉ</mi><mi>K</mi></msub><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>Œ∏</mi><mi>K</mi></msub><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mi>D</mi><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mi>u</mi></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">=</mo><mi>f</mi></mrow></mtd><mtd/></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mi/></mtd><mtd/></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</mi><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><msub><mi>Œ∏</mi><mi>K</mi></msub></mpadded></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">=</mo><mrow><msub><mi>Œª</mi><mi>K</mi></msub><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>Œ∏</mi><mi>K</mi></msub><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>‚Å¢</mo><msup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mi>u</mi></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>œÉ</mi><mi>K</mi></msub><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>Œ∏</mi><mi>K</mi></msub><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd/></mtr></mtable></mrow></math>
